intro: Amphicosmia strigosa, commonly known as the roughleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant has small, linear leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a rough texture. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with four petals arranged in a cross shape. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
